moves.1. e4: Your opponent is white... your Black.. This is a random game that you have just lost and i'll take you through it... ok your opponent has started with a normal everyday move and it gives you plenty to move towards.
moves.1... e5: normal counter move... your starting to open up F8 is ready to move and the queen but you don't wanna move the queen yet...
moves.2. Nf3: its a gd move from your opponent. He's starting to attack
moves.2... d6: I don't agree with that move. 1) Its leaving your queen open 2)Your taking a defence against attack (not gd) 3) F8 has now been blocked for an advance. You could have pulled a knight out which would off protected your pawn and went for an attack
moves.3. Bc4 Nf6: gd... starting to attack but... that guy is 1 move ahead of you
moves.4. d3: thats a gd move from the person your playing... its a gd start to the game from there part. They have set up for the next move
moves.4... c6: why? i can't see why you have done that... it might develop
moves.5... Rg8: why??? Horse is now ready to move??? why??
moves.6. Nxf7: he's put your queen under pressure. I'll stop now but i hope i've helped
